intro: Acetosella borjensis, commonly known as the Borjens' sorrel, is a small perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Acetosella borjensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on alpine flora and plant adaptation strategies.
